case_title: GHULAM MUJTABA KHAN vs PROVINCE OF BALUCHISTAN AND ANOTHER
issues: Legality of appellant's reinstatement by the Minister without approval of the Governor.
Validity of compulsory retirement order issued without waiting for appellant's explanation.

appellant: No specific allegations made against appellant.
Compulsory retirement order issued without opportunity for appellant to be heard.
Reinstatement order acted upon and cannot be challenged.
respondents: Reinstatement order by Minister was null and void.
Dismissal order by Governor was final and binding.
Compulsory retirement order followed proper rules and procedures.

key_points.dismissal_reason: Misconduct under West Pakistan Government Servants (Efficiency and Discipline) Rules, 1960.
key_points.reinstatement_reason: Minister's claim that charges did not constitute misconduct.
key_points.compulsory_retirement_reason: Persistent reputation of corruption and malpractices.

legal_references.title: West Pakistan Government Servants (Efficiency and Discipline) Rules, 1960
Baluchistan Civil Servants (Efficiency and Discipline) Rules, 1974
Article 129 of the Constitution of Pakistan
legal_references.application: Defines executive authority of the province.

legal_references.title: General Clauses Act, Section 21
legal_references.application: Authority to amend or rescind orders.

judgment_summary.reinstatement_order: Declared null and void as Minister lacked authority.
judgment_summary.compulsory_retirement_order: Upheld as valid under applicable rules.
